column3:
Programs that jump to the foreground when they want your attention are
terrible.

There are better ways; a blinking icon, a notification, etc. (remember that
any js can send bitcoin urls) This is heavily dependent on the window
environment so hopefully Qt has a function for it.

If I click an bitcoin: URL and nothing happens that is simply not good ... what do you expect from clicking a mailto: link? From my side I would like my mail client startet as the foreground application, have the address filled in. How is your preference here?\n\nHow differ bitcoin: links from mailto: links? I've never seen a script that spams me with mailto: and opens tons of Thunderbird windows

I just read that windows 7 does the right thing when activatewindow is
called: blink the entry on the taskbar. No "focus stealing" is allowed. So
this patch is fine.
